style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener
style.description: Traditional Bohemian Pilseners are medium bodied, and they can be as dark as a light amber color. This style balances moderate bitterness and noble-type hop aroma and flavor with a malty, slightly sweet, medium body. Extremely low levels of diacetyl and low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are characteristic of this style and both may accent malt aroma. A toasted-, biscuit-like, bready malt character along with low levels of sulfur compounds may be evident. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

breweries.name: Bier Brewery & Taproom
breweries.description: The Bier Brewery and Taproom is excited to be one of the newest breweries in Indiana.  We are committed to the highest quality and best tasting bier in Indianapolis.  Our small size allows BIER to have the utmost control over the many different variables that go into brewing a batch of beer.

data.name: Harvest Colonial Pilsner
data.description: Take a traditional recipe for pilsner and top it off with a load of “New World” hops. What do you get? A classic pilsner with a twist: wet hops from High Five Hops Farm. Pilsner malt and pilsner yeast as well as weeks of cold conditioning make this a well-balanced, hoppy lager. Celebrate the harvest!

breweries.name: Pleasant House Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Pleasant House Brewing Company is an independently owned microbrewery focusing on small-batch, true-to-style beers, especially traditional UK styles.

The original Pleasant House is an 1800s cottage that still looks out on the rolling green hills of rural Yorkshire, England. In the 1950s and ’60s, the Jackson family called Pleasant House home. Today, it is the inspiration behind husband and wife team Art and Chelsea Jackson’s Pleasant House restaurants and microbrewery. Our beers pair brilliantly with our award-winning, savory Royal Pies and other British-inspired, locally sourced specialties.

All of our microbrews are crafted on the premises in our historic 1887 building in Three Oaks, Michigan.

data.name: Hera-Pils
data.description:
Brewed in honor of Hera, Queen of the Gods. Beautifully light and refreshing, Hera Pils is a traditional Czech-style Pilsner. 
Crisp and clean with delicate hop flavor, this lager is as elegant as the goddess herself.
Draft, Cans

breweries.name: Saint Arnold Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Saint Arnold Brewing Company, located in Houston, is Texas' Oldest Craft Brewery. Our goal is to brew world class beers and deliver them to our customers as fresh as possible making them the best beers in Texas and Louisiana. Our customers are beer lovers - people that appreciate great, full-flavored beers.

Our small crew does everything at the brewery: brew the beer, filter the beer, keg the beer, bottle the beer, sell the beer and drink the beer. For us, this is a passion, not a job. We believe that this comes through in the beers we make. Our beers have soul.

We brew several different beers; some are year round, some are seasonal and a few are single batch brews. They are available in bars, restaurants, grocery stores, liquor stores and warehouse stores throughout Texas and Louisiana.

Our first keg of beer was shipped on June 9, 1994. Founded by Brock Wagner and Kevin Bartol, we chose Houston because, other than living here, this was the largest city in the country that did not have a microbrewery. Brock was a longtime homebrewer and had considered opening a brewery as far back as college, although that was quickly dismissed as a silly idea. Seven years after graduating, Brock revisited the idea, enlisted Kevin's help and the brewery was off and running. Kevin has since left the business after a bitter battle. (Just kidding - but don't you wish people wrote that when it was the truth?).

Please visit us if you are in Houston. We have a public open house every weekday at 3:00 PM and every Saturday starting at 11:00 AM.

Cheers!

data.name: Illumination
data.description: The 42nd parallel has been home to some of the world’s greatest luminaries. Writers, philosophers, and craftsman whose creativity, risk taking, and foresight have inspired generations. The Illumination Bohemian Pilsner is brewed to be as authentic as possible to the birthplace of real lager, Plzen, and uses only Czech Saaz hops and the best European malts available. Crisp and refreshing yet very flavorful, Illumination boasts a slightly sweet malt character with a prevalent spicy and floral hop profile.

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener

breweries.name: 42 North Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Certain locations around the world hold within them an unspoken power. They’re where wars were fought, fortunes lost – and found – and where legacies are made.

And, these places happen to be connected by a common thread. Unseen to the naked eye, yet felt in its magnetic persuasion. It is the 42nd Parallel. Crossing Russia, Italy, France, and Spain. And Great American cities like Boston, Detroit, and Buffalo. It’s the border of California and Oregon, New York and Pennsylvania, and, in many instances, countries including the United States and Canada.

And when it comes to beer, the 42nd parallel is unparalleled as well. Some of the world’s best hops grow along it, and in the late 1800’s and early 1900’s, it’s where New York State hops grew bountiful and full-bodied. This tradition – and the legacy of arguably the most important parallel on earth – have found a new home, and a new future, here: at 42 North.

breweries.name: Narragansett Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Narragansett Beer is New England's oldest beer, founded in 1890. It was the #1 beer New England from 1919 through the 1970's and the official beer of the Red Sox for over 30 years. It's now one of the fastest growing beers in New England and was winner of the Bronze Medal at the 2008 World Beer Cup.

Narragansett has always been for New Englanders. That's why in these especially troubling times, we want to build a brand new brewery in the heart of New England. The brewery would provide a slew of new jobs and help stimulate New England's economy. We need to sell 7.5 million cases of beer a year to be able to make it all happen. And to do that, we need you! So Drink your part! You buy a case, we build a brewery.

data.name: Independence Pilsner
data.description: Light aromas of bread and honey compliment a refreshingly crisp finish on this delightfully drinkable lager. Generously hopped with all Liberty hops to lend the perfect amount of bitterness and spice, while also giving it a touch of American flare. This beer pours a beautiful golden color with a head that stands up to any moustache. Light in body but full in flavor; this ain’t your pappy’s pilsner!

breweries.name: American Brewing Company
breweries.description: America is a country built on tradition and defiance. At American Brewing Co., we pour a little bit of this heritage into each one of our meticulously crafted beers. We honor our fore-brewers by heeding their lessons of technique and style; however innovation allows us to stand apart. We enjoy taking classic styles and giving them a twist, using science and inspiration as our guides. There is a revolution afoot and we are crafting it pint by pint. Join us in the charge and drink on the right side of history!

breweries.name: Brewmaster Jack
breweries.description:
Brewmaster Jack was started in 2011 by Northampton, MA resident Tyler Guilmette. While we currently only produce our flagship beer, Stray Dog Lager, we plan on releasing several more recipes in the future. Keep updated on the latest beer news by following us on Twitter or on our Facebook page. 

As a company, we believe in buying locally. That's why we are currently working with Valley Malt in Hadley, Massachusetts (one of just two malting facilities east of Wisconsin and one of the only small-scale malthouses in the country) to incorporate local grains into our recipe. All of our beer produced in 2012 will include at least 25% organic, locally-malted grain with the eventual goal of improving to 100%. 

Brewmaster Jack is proud to have our beer produced at Paper City Brewery in Holyoke, Massachusetts.

data.name: Kamelot
data.description:
Origin of name: the name is taken from the technological process of maturing where the beer matures (lies) for up to seven weeks. The year 2000 was an anniversary year as it was 470 years from the time of the first written report of the brewery. The brewery prepared special variants and recipes throughout the year e.g. to Christmas under the name Sváteční Lager for this significant event. 

Taste: it has an excellent taste similar to Tas beer, with a subtle to slightly insensitive bitterness which slowly disappears after drinking. In contrast to Tas beer it is crisper and its color ranges from golden yellow to a shade of golden brown. The biggest difference is its fullness because the higher degrees Pluto give this beer a fuller taste, which can be described as being bready.

data.name: Klisch Pilsner
data.description:
Named after our brewery's founders, Russ and Jim Klisch, this beer is brewed in the tradition of great Czech pilsners. 

A beautiful, brilliant blonde-gold pour with a light hoppy aroma. Malts and a slight hop bitterness round out the flavor of this classic style. Klisch is a smooth and full bodied golden lager you'll remember forever.
data.foodPairings: Try Klisch Pilsner with any Bohemian or German dish, especially sausages. This beer has a full enough body to stand up to spicy and rich foods as well.

breweries.name: Lakefront Brewery
breweries.description: Milwaukee’s own Lakefront Brewery Inc. started in 1987.  The industrious and inventive microbrewery located on the Milwaukee River has become a Milwaukee landmark.  Its rich history includes partnerships with local taverns, preservation of local historical pieces, unique tours, family style dining options and most importantly, great beer.

data.name: Küsterer Bohemian Pilsner
data.description: A Bohemian cellar-style pilsner with a soft, herbal nose, clean body and a crisp finish, this is the style of beer that eventually evolved into American lager towards the end of the 19th Century. It’s approachable, nuanced and refreshing…reminding us what an everyman beer can be.

breweries.name: Carver Brewing Company
breweries.description: Operating as a brewery since 1988, we are Colorado's 2nd oldest brew pub. We maintain a tap list of 11 house made beers, produce over 20 different beer styles per year and specialize in recreating traditional lager beer styles and hop-centric American-Style ales. Our restaurant offers American fare with an International influence, focusing on healthy, made-from-scratch items that incorporate locally sourced ingredients. We serve breakfast, lunch and dinner seven days a week, 363 days a year.

data.name: Lager
data.description: A hand crafted European style pilsner, brewed with a combination of the finest malts and hops. The spicy hop aromas and flavours are magnificently balanced by biscuity malt sweetness. This beer works well with many foods but is perfect for spicy dishes such as Thai and Vietnamese; the bitterness cuts through the heat to leave the flavour of the food.
data.foodPairings: This beer works well with many foods but is perfect for spicy dishes such as Thai and Vietnamese; the bitterness cuts through the heat to leave the flavour of the food.

breweries.name: Hunter Beer Co
breweries.description:
What we do here at HBC is make beer, great beer, great beer that we enjoy drinking. We also have the opportunity to share our love of beer with visitors who drop by to watch us work, sample our wares or just have a chat. We make a large range of beers with a huge range of colours, aromas & flavours & we firmly believe there is a beer in there for everyone – and the only real way to find out is by visiting us and tasting the beer!
 
Our brewery is very small, one of the smallest in the country. We strive to create a beer experience for our customers. Visit the brewery, chat to a brewer, watch us at work - the person who made the beer will be pouring the beer for you to enjoy!
 
Most of our beer is sold on-site, but if you are unable to visit us our beer is available in other locations (several restaurants, pubs and bottleshops) or you can order on-line .

breweries.name: Tyskie Kompania Piwowarska
breweries.description:
Kompania Piwowarska is a brewing company established in Poland in 1999 as a result of the merger of two SABMiller owned Polish breweries, Lech Browary Wielkopolski S.A. in Poznań and Browary Tyskie Górny Śląsk SA. in Tychy. Browary Tyskie Górny Śląsk was founded in 1629. The company also owns the Dojlidy Brewery in Białystok.

The three breweries have a total capacity of 15.1 million hectolitres. SABMiller purchased a majority share in the Lech and Tyskie breweries in 1995.

data.name: Lectronic Lager
data.description: Lectronic Lager is a light and refreshing beer brewed with traditional Bohemian lager yeast.  The beer pours as a pale yellow color and the soft aromas that accompany it are of doughy bread and a faint pear sweetness.  Flavors of hearty grain and yeast are followed by a medium bitterness before a relatively crisp clean finish.

breweries.name: Short's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In April of 2004 we opened the doors to Short’s Brewing Company in the quaint Village of Bellaire.  Beer was the mission, and liberation was the movement.  With a lot of elbow grease, blind ambition and a little luck, the quest to create a community pub in Northwest Lower Michigan began to take shape.  The philosophy was to bring an appreciation of craft beer to the north with product education and creativity.  The process of appreciation through education we call beer liberation.

Today Short’s Brewing Company continues the effort to educate and liberate consumers.  We take pride in our hands on, mom and pop approach and the energy we put into the quality of our beer, food, staff, customers and facilities. We believe in the power of the smallness.   We intend on remaining a smaller, state wide beer distributor and focusing our energies close to home (the SBC Michigan stimulus package).  Our goal is to get to a comfortable production volume, enjoy what we do and love life in Northern Michigan.

data.name: Leviathan Big Bohemian Pilsner
data.description: This installment of the Harpoon Leviathan Series was brewed in the centuries-old tradition of Czech and Bohemian brewers.  Harpoon Big Bohemian is a large lager with a clean maltiness and a huge aromatic hop character.

breweries.name: Harpoon Brewery
breweries.description:
We started the Harpoon Brewery in 1986 because—like today—we loved beer and wanted more quality choices.  

There was only one problem: we were beer lovers, not brewers. We knew what we wanted to drink, but we needed some help actually brewing it. So we enlisted our first brewer, took over some warehouse space on the Boston waterfront, and began introducing fresh, local craft beer to Boston drinkers. We tried to do it in a way that captured the spirit of fun that had brought us to beer in the first place. From that warehouse, surrounded by fish companies on the docks of South Boston (neighboring what is now the Seaport District), we couldn’t imagine that craft brewing would become what it has today.  

We still remember our days on the other side of the bar, and have spent as much time spreading the joy of beer drinking as we have focusing on recipes, ingredients, and brewing equipment. Hopefully our sense of gratitude is reflected in both the quality of the beer and the spirit of fun and enjoyment surrounding our beer and breweries. We invite all of you to visit our Boston brewery, where it all began, and our beautiful brewery in Windsor, Vermont.

data.name: Lil's Pils
data.description: This traditional bohemian pilsner is light, crisp, and has a wonderful floral hop bouquet that balances the complex malty taste of the all German barley.

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener

breweries.name: Seven Brides Brewery
breweries.description:
Silverton, Oregon has much to offer. Known for its beautiful landscape of Silver Falls State Park and home of the Oregon Garden, it is rich with color and flavor. The town is lined with antique and coffee shops, restaurants and murals, but no micro-breweries, until now.

Seven Brides Brewing is changing that!

Several years ago, three dads and two uncles would gather on a Saturday in one of their garages to master the art of home brew. Before long, the salesman of the group said, “You know, this is good enough to sell.” So the friends set out to do just that.

The name “Seven Brides” actually came from the dads’ kids. Between three of them, they have seven daughters. With the rising cost of wedding nuptials, the guys decided they needed to sell enough beer to pay for their daughters weddings. Each of the girls has a beer named after her.

data.name: Little Bo Pils
data.description:
This unfiltered pale lager is all about subtlety and balance.

Expect a delicate spice, a touch of honey, and rustic white bread in the nose of this classic Czech style pilsner. Flavors of bread crust and light malt meet the spice of traditional Czech Saaz hops and while the finish is crisp and bracingly bitter, everything is in balance.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener
style.description: Traditional Bohemian Pilseners are medium bodied, and they can be as dark as a light amber color. This style balances moderate bitterness and noble-type hop aroma and flavor with a malty, slightly sweet, medium body. Extremely low levels of diacetyl and low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are characteristic of this style and both may accent malt aroma. A toasted-, biscuit-like, bready malt character along with low levels of sulfur compounds may be evident. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

breweries.name: Smog City Brewing
breweries.description: Smog City Brewing is a Los Angeles based brewery devoted to putting its mark on the craft beer scene with exceptionally balanced and creatively inspired beers.

data.name: Little Red Pils
data.description: What have our brewers thought up now! Tyler West and Brett Thomas felt our Bridge Creek Pilsner needed some dressing up for Febrewary. So, we bring you Little Red. A Czech / Bohemian Pilsner with a touch of dark malt rendering a deep red color to this great lager. Hopped with Tettnanger and Czech Saaz hops, Little Red drinks like a light lager with a touch of spice. Enjoy.

breweries.name: Great Lakes Brewery
breweries.description:
Founded in 1987, Great Lakes Brewery is Toronto's oldest craft brewery.
We produce the finest ales and lagers made with all natural, premium ingredients. Our award winning beers are handcrafted in small batches using an historic open-fire copper kettle.

breweries.name: Throwback Brewery
breweries.description: Throwback is a small, inspired brewery dedicated to crafting delicious, farm-fresh beers from local ingredients.  Our goal at Throwback is to acquire most of our ingredients (such as hops, wheat, barley, fruit, and spices) from local farmers.  While we are not quite there today, it is our vision that eventually 100% of our ingredients will be sourced locally, including the malt.

breweries.name: Faustino - Microcervejeira, Lda.
breweries.description:
Faustino Microcervejeira is a production and trading company of Craft Beer. It produces several beers under various brand names that come to you with the utmost care and quality that we can.

As we only use particular beer ingredients, barley, hops, yeast and water, we obtain an end product which distinguishes itself from the soda flavor, the aroma, the gas and until the foam.

We also do not filter out our beer as it removes the same properties and with sterilization eliminates any living yeast. Did you know that in ancient times beer was the safest way to drink water? This is because beers have a long duration without spoiling due to microorganisms responsible for fermentation yeasts. These can overlap with agents that invade their surroundings, beer, killing them. Due to the lower alcohol content does not lead to dehydration as much as other alcoholic beverages. Thus one Brew is valid for drinking from about 1 year. The most interesting is that adequately conditioned beers, depending on the style, last up to five or even more years in the most extreme cases. Our all beers last more than 1 year but because the properties change with time, to better almost always guarantee only that period to enjoy what described on the label.

How do fermentation in the bottle always guarantee that the beer will live yeast to the consumer, which on the one hand clears the beer and the other creates gas in it. Because of this fermentation in the bottle our beers have always deposit. These beers should have deposit, because besides any indication of handmade process demonstrates that there has been fermentation in the bottle.

data.description: Moat Czech Pilsner – 4.9 % a.b.v. our interpretation of a  Bohemian style pilsner. Clean and crisp with a wonderful hop bouquet in the nose and medium in hop bitterness.

breweries.name: Grupo Modelo S.A. de C.V.
breweries.description: Grupo Modelo, founded in 1925, is the leader in Mexico in beer production, distribution and marketing, with 63.0% of the total (domestic and export) market share, as of December 31, 2008. It has seven brewing plants in Mexico, with a total annual installed capacity of 60 million hectoliters. It is the importer of Anheuser-Busch InBev’s products in Mexico, including Budweiser, Bud Light and O’Doul’s. It also imports the Chinese Tsingtao brand and the Danish beer Carlsberg. Through a partnership with Nestlé Waters, it produces and distributes in Mexico the bottled water brands Sta. María and Nestlé Pureza Vital, among others.

data.name: Moravian Rhapsody
data.description: Crisp, hoppy and refreshing; our Pilsener is brewed with traditional Pilsner malt, Saaz hops, and German Lager yeast. Clean bitterness is balanced by sharp graininess and a crisp finish. This lager is an excellent selection for those just getting into craft beer.

breweries.name: Raleigh Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Raleigh Brewing Company will house a 20 bbl brew system to produce 6 year-round beers, 2 seasonal beers, and various experimental beers. All of our beers will be available in our taproom, which is located at the brewery. The taproom will have dartboards, a comfy lounge, and a few TVs for those days when the game is on. 

Our beer will also be available to the public. Ask for it at your local watering hole! 

At Raleigh Brewing Company we intend to be a big part of the local Raleigh community. We plan to do that by staying as green as possible by reclaiming our water used to brew with, recycling, and conserving energy, donating money/beer/time to local charities, and opening up our space for local groups/organizations/events as much as possible. If there's anything you'd like to see us do, just shoot us an email! 

We look forward to opening our doors and serving you some hand-crafted beers, which will hopefully be at the very beginning of 2013! 

Cheers!

breweries.name: Southern Oregon Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Then we invite you to sample the hand-crafted brews of the Southern Oregon Brewing Company.
Brewed with uncompromised standards in Medford, Oregon, we’re dedicated to producing a full line of tantalizing brews using old-world brewing techniques and only the finest natural ingredients.

Served at discriminating restaurants and bars, one sip and you'll know that you've discovered something quiet extraordinary… beer that has been crafted by beer lovers for beer lovers.
As a Southern Oregon owned crafted brewery, we’re dedicated to the highest standards of quality and returning a percentage of our profits to the local community.

data.name: Natty B.O.B
data.description:
The award winning recipe of the 2014 Battle of the Bubbles 
 
This year's brew is a traditional Czech style Bohemian Pilsner, made with top quality German floor malted pilsner make and Czech saaz hops.  It's crisp and clean, the perfect thing for sitting outdoors this summer.

breweries.name: Barley and Hops Grill & Microbrewery
breweries.description:
When the same old thing just won’t do, head to Barley & Hops! You’ll find great beer brewed the old-fashioned way, award-winning  food, and a friendly atmosphere you don’t get in those cookie-cutter restaurants. Conveniently located in Frederick, Maryland at the interchange of I-70 and I-270, Barley and Hops is just a short Drive from Baltimore, Washington, and the surrounding tri-state area.

Whether you are shopping at the mall or antiquing in our historic downtown, Barley and Hops provides the perfect break for lunch, entertaining guests, or an unforgettable evening dinner. Also a great place to take in the game, learn about the art of brewing, or meet new friends. From the large screen TV to the glass enclosed working brewery, there is always something to do or see. 

Open Sunday, 11:00 a.m. ’til 10:00 p.m; Monday through Thursday, 11:00 a.m. ’til 11:00 p.m.; and Friday and Saturday, 11:00 a.m. ’til midnight. Call ahead of your visit at 301-668-5555 to check on seating availability.

breweries.description: Backpocket Beer is German-inspired and hand-crafted right here in Iowa. We strive to provide Iowans with a simple, enjoyable world-class beer.

data.name: Nomad
data.description: Nomad is our spin on the classic Bohemian Pilsner style.  The journey starts with German malts and Saaz hops that offer a lively floral nose and crispness, while a full 5 weeks of lagering time ensures that Nomad is eminently balanced.  This Nomad may wander, but it's got some serious roots.
data.foodPairings: Pan seared trout, grilled pork tenderloin with fresh rosemary, Avalanche Cheese Co. Robiola (Colorado), crispy Brussels sprouts, salted caramel ice cream.

breweries.name: Great Divide Brewing Company
breweries.description:
These beers have landed an impressive amount of acclaim: Great Divide beers have earned 18 Great American Beer Festival medals and 5 World Beer Cup awards. Great Divide was also ranked 8th in Ratebeer.com’s 2010 “The Best Brewers in the World” and was ranked 7th in Beer Advocate’s 2009 “All-Time Top Breweries on Planet Earth.”

But why take their word for it? Crack open a bottle and decide for yourself.

data.name: Nordy Pilsner
data.description: Our crisp and refreshing Bavarian-inspired Pilsner highlights Hersbruker, Tettnanger and Czech Saaz hops.

breweries.description:
Craft brewery and beer destination on a prominent corner in the heart of West Sacramento's industrial Port District. 

Guest brewing services and our small batch craft brewery are prominently featured in our beer hall. The outdoor "beer dock" will provide casual, comfortable, shaded enjoyment of our beers

data.name: Not So Old Bohemian Pilsner
data.description: Pilsner and Vienna malts make this a true craft lager  (yea, yea, we know it’s the yeast that makes it a lager); you won’t find corn or rice in this Bohemian-style Lager.  In true Bohemian style, this light lager is brewed with Czech Saaz hops.  One of our lightest brews, this one is especially made for drinking all summer long.
data.foodPairings: Light salad, veggies, pita and hummus, light barbecued foods, grilled pizza.

breweries.name: Tomfoolery Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Tomfoolery Brewing is an independent, craft brewery located in Hammonton, NJ. We brew for the taste of the beer, for the same reason you drink it. 

Our beers pour bright; filled with clarity.  Not only visually appealing, but also with crisp, clean flavors that pop with each swig.  We take great pride in all of our beers, every step of the way.

data.name: Oak Creek Gold Lager
data.description: Fresh malty pilsner with a good hop-malt balance and a dense, white rocky head of foam. It is a cold-lagered, naturally carbonated all-malt beer.

breweries.name: Oak Creek Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
The Kraus family came to Sedona in 1993 with all their worldly goods and a dream, to brew great fresh beer the way Fred learned at the Gasthausbrauerei Hufeisen, or Horseshoe Brewery, in the picturesque village of Pottenstein, Germany. The dream became reality when they opened the doors of Oak Creek Brewing Co. in west Sedona.

Since February 1995 Sedona's only Microbrewery has been known to locals and tourists alike as the place to enjoy delicious handcrafted brews in a relaxed, unique setting.

data.name: Organic Discerning Pilsner
data.description: Descerning Pilsner is a Bohemian style lager like the original brewed in Pilsen, Czech republic. This beer is made only with organic Pilsner malt, Czech Saaz hops and very soft water. This beer is decoction mashed in the old world method. It is well balanced between floral hop bitterness and malty sweetness.

breweries.description: Wildwood Brewery is a organic craft brewery in Western Montana committed to building an integrated brewing/farming system where all wastes are used as value-added input.

data.name: P.O.C. Pride of Cleveland Pilsner
data.description: The new P.O.C. is a Euro-style Pilsner has unsurpassed flavor and body. Just enough pale malt to give off complex, floral, grainy notes supported by handfuls of authentic East European hops (even in the storage vessel) to bring a deep rooted bitterness to the palate.

breweries.name: Big Time Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Big Time's brewery is a 14 barrel JV Northwest system consisting of a gas fired brew kettle, an infusion mash tun with mixer, a hot liquor back, a wort cooler, (5) 14 barrel fermenters, (1) bright beer tank, and (20) 7 bbl serving tanks.  

We sell 85% of our beer at the pub but do wholesale a limited number of kegs to a dozen or so Seattle area taverns. We currently brew approximately 1,300 barrels of beer per year

data.name: Palm Tree Caribbean Lager
data.description: An homage to the islands, with hints of spice and a strong malt character, this pilsner is light, refreshing, and sure to make you feel like you're relaxing on a tropical beach. In short, it's pretty darn tasty.

breweries.name: Odyssey Beerwerks
breweries.description:
Back when the world was a much different place, filled with grunge music, loose fitting clothes, and Wayne’s World movies, two shady characters fell in together and started doing various sketch and wonderful things. One of these was brewing . . . beer. Not the tasty, modern, complex craft beers flowing in today’s market, but the goofy and “just OK” beers that home brewers in the 90’s seemed to know how to build. These guys (we’ll call them Chris and Josh for lack of anonymity’s sake) got better at brewing over the years, even as they moved apart.

Chris went down a corporate marketing path; Josh seemed to prefer engineering and operations; both still enjoyed beer and, with lots of practice, the homebrew got better and better. When Y2K sputtered out before it even came to life, the two had their first discussion about opening a brewery. More life happened. More of the guys’ improving craft beers were served at more home parties. When they got together again more recently, the topic resurfaced, but this time it wouldn’t go away. And gradually a brewery was born.

20 years since the start of their homebrew hobbies, Odyssey Beerwerks was formed to do the impossible: take an enjoyable hobby of creating fine craft beers and make it into a dreary job, with the benefit of bringing new and exciting hand crafted beers onto our vibrant planet.

data.name: Paradise Road Pilsner
data.description:
Paradise Road runs from Highway 154 into the Los Padres National Forest and inspired this Bohemian style lager with its refreshing streams and waterfalls.  This golden pilsner derives its character from the delicate balance of European lager yeast and German Noble hops.  Enjoy this beer after a long hike or during a picnic in the great outdoors.

Gold Medal, 2014 and 2011 Denver International Beer Competitions
Silver, 2014 Los Angeles International Beer Competition
Honorable Mention, 2011 Los Angeles International Beer Competition

breweries.name: Figueroa Mountain Brewing
breweries.description: Figueroa Mountain Brewing Co. was founded by father and son team, Jim and Jaime Dietenhofer, in 2010.  With a passion for craft beer, they set out to pay homage to the beautiful Santa Ynez Valley with handcrafted beer and hand-drawn artwork depicting the local landscape on their labels.  There are currently five taprooms along California’s Central Coast and one taproom set to open in Westlake Village late summer 2015.  Figueroa Mountain Brewing Co. beer can be found in their taprooms or at select retailers and restaurants throughout California.  Learn more about @FigMtnBrew or where to find their beer at www.FigMtnBrew.com.

11am-10pm Mon-Wed, 11am-11pm Thurs-Sat, 11am-9pm Sun

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener
style.description: Traditional Bohemian Pilseners are medium bodied, and they can be as dark as a light amber color. This style balances moderate bitterness and noble-type hop aroma and flavor with a malty, slightly sweet, medium body. Extremely low levels of diacetyl and low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are characteristic of this style and both may accent malt aroma. A toasted-, biscuit-like, bready malt character along with low levels of sulfur compounds may be evident. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

breweries.name: Surinaamse Brouwerij
breweries.description: The Surinaamse Brouwerij is the only brewery in Suriname and the proud brewery of Parbo beer, the famous national beer in Suriname.

data.name: Park Day
data.description: This traditional Bohemian-style Pilsner is brewed with 100% German malt and hops. Straw in color, this light-bodied brew offers a floral, malty nose and clean, crisp malty hop taste. Enjoy Park Day for a day in the park or all year long.

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener

This style balances moderate bitterness and noble-type hop aroma and flavor with a malty, slightly sweet, medium body. Extremely low levels of diacetyl and low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are characteristic of this style and both may accent malt aroma. A toasted-, biscuit-like, bready malt character along with low levels of sulfur compounds may be evident. There should be no chill haze. Its head should be dense and rich.

breweries.name: Mother Earth Brewing Company
breweries.description: Mother Earth Brewing Company is located on the corner of Heritage and North Street in Kinston NC. The facility includes the brewery itself, a bottling facility and Mother Earth’s corporate offices. In keeping with our company name, our rehabilitation of this old building is incorporating green technology, eco-friendly building materials and alternative energy sources wherever possible. Future plans include opening a tap room and offering tours of the brewery. Mother Earth’s four staple beers are a Munich Dunkel, an American IPA (organic), a Belgian Wit and a Kolsch, along with seasonal brews and oak aged beers. Mother Earth will distribute statewide in groceries, restaurants, and bars. Look for Mother Earth products soon..

data.name: Patio Pounding Pilz
data.description: A tradition Bohemian-Style Pilsner. Soft clean malt up front, subtle spicy and floral hop notes.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener

This style balances moderate bitterness and noble-type hop aroma and flavor with a malty, slightly sweet, medium body. Extremely low levels of diacetyl and low levels of sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) character, if perceived, are characteristic of this style and both may accent malt aroma. breweries.name: Lowdown Brewery + Kitchen
breweries.description:
LowDown is the culmination of 20+ years of professional brewing experience. LowDown owners Scott and Phil have won numerous awards, including accolades from The Great American Beer Festival.  We don’t just stop at great beer, we serve great food too.  We only serve the best seasonal menu items with quality ingredients.

LowDown understands what it means to give back. We know that we reside in a neighborhood many people call home. Making our neigborhood and everything around it better is part of our mission.

From our casual environment to educating our staff, we're redefining the brewery experience. At LowDown we're passionate about quality beer, great and sustainable food, and making memories with good friends.

data.name: Pau Hana Pilsner
data.description:
Pau Hana Pilsner has a bright golden color with a creamy white head. Floral Saaz hops
contribute to the spicy hop flavor and refreshingly dry finish. Euro Pils malt provides refined malt sweetness that compliments the hop profile.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Maui Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Maui Brewing Co., with a brewpub in Kahana and production brewery in Kihei, has built a reputation for creating handcrafted beers brewed using the finest natural ingredients.  We have become one of the area's most popular dining locations and are Hawaii's largest craft brewery.  Our menu offers a broad selection of fine foods to satisfy any palate.

data.name: Peacemaker Pilsner
data.description: Using Nobel hops our brewer has created a well balanced beer with a nice golden color and a crisp dry finish. Light in color, this pilsner is brewed in the classic Bohemian style.

style.name: Bohemian-Style Pilsener

breweries.name: Pug Ryan's Steakhouse and Brewery
breweries.description: Located in Dillon, Colorado Pug Ryan's has been one of Summit County's best steakhouse and craft breweries since 1975. Come try our award winning brews with a great steak, prime rib or fresh seafood.

data.name: Perfecta
data.description: Down the stretch comes Perfecta Pils, a 5.4% abv Bohemian style pilsner. Crisp, complex, & well rounded with a subtle of note of Tangerine citrus in the finish from the addition of German Mandarina Bavaria hops, this golden lager will surely please your palate while playing the ponies or just kicking back in the grandstands.

breweries.name: Union Craft Brewing Company
breweries.description: Union Craft Brewing is a homegrown, independent craft brewery located in the Clipper Mill area of Woodberry. We are dedicated to providing the good people of Baltimore fresh, handcrafted, and approachable beers and to fostering the community that forms whenever great beer is flowing.

data.name: Phoenix Gold
data.description: This unpasteurized Bohemian lager is no ordinary bird. As refreshing as it is smooth, Phoenix showcases well-balanced malt flavours with a crisp, dry finish. Plummet into a flaming spiral of satisfaction.
data.foodPairings: spicy Asian foods, seafood, medium cheeses

breweries.description: We are a small-batch craft brewery located on the bottom of a medium-sized island on the left coast of a very large country.
